title: Onsite Rental maps out proposed IPO, targets November 18 listing
text:
Equipment hire group Onsite Rental's management team will start meeting fund managers on Monday to formally kick off its run at the ASX-boards.

Stockbrokers Macquarie Capital and Merrill Lynch Equities blasted a launch message to fund managers on Monday morning, mapping out Onsite Rental's proposed path to Australian bourse.

The brokers expect to run a bookbuild to sell shares on October 28 and 29, the term sheet said, while Onsite Rental wants to be trading on a conditional and deferred settlement basis from November 18.

Interestingly, there was no proposed price or offer structure in the Bloomberg message.

Funds were told the IPO was designed to provide Onsite Rental with access to capital markets, broaden its shareholder based, fund growth initiatives, repay existing debt, and help pay selling shareholders under the company's SaleCo deed.

The management roadshow comes after Onsite's brokers spent one week marketing to fund managers. The brokers said the business-to-business equipment hire company was worth as much as $700 million in detailed reports sent to clients.
description: Equipment hire group Onsite Rental's management team will start meeting fund managers on Monday to formally kick off its run at the ASX-boards.
